The time has now come when we need to hide in the cleft of the Rock, and view the character of God. Enoch walked with God 300 years. He reflected upon God, he contemplated his character, and his life was well-pleasing in the sight of God. And on the part of his children today there should be just such a meditation upon the Word of God. It should not only be read, but carefully studied; for it furnishes the only safe standard and guide in the 


                                  -412- 

formation of moral character, and the only sure road to intellectual culture.--Ms 29, 1896, pp. 6, 8. (October 31, 1896.)
